required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators aim to investigate the feasibility of using mobile application platform for sonographic education.
Junior physicians at the National Taiwan University Hospital will be enrolled in this study. To design and develop a secure mobile application platform (consisting of mobile device and a cloud-based server) for interactive teaching, remote social-based consultation and discussion. The information exchange through the platform carries images and simulated cases.
This pioneer study can provide experience of mobile sonographic education and contribute to current medical education. Moreover, it can improve decision-making process and quality of care, and could lessen crowdedness at emergency departments. Furthermore, the integrated platform can be used in other educational programs in the future.

detailed_description.textblock:
As usual, it takes time for junior emergency physicians to have good diagnostic accuracy through traditional sonographic education. Applying the technology built in this project, junior emergency physicians will be provided with intelligent learning programs anywhere and anytime.
Junior physicians at the National Taiwan University Hospital will be enrolled in this study.

arm_group.description: Before the hand-on practice and assessements, the participants use the platform for learning.

arm_group.arm_group_label: without use of the educational platform
arm_group.description: Before the hand-on practice and assessements, the participants did not use the platform for learning.

intervention.description: The platform would be opened before they entered the study.

study_pop.textblock: The junior physicians of the department of emergency medicine of the National Taiwan University Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
The junior physicians of the department of emergency medicine of the National Taiwan University Hospital.
Exclusion criteria:
The junior physicians of the department of emergency medicine of the National Taiwan University Hospital, refused to enter the study.
